Solomon or Canticles__08.1: Who shall give thee to me for my brother, sucking the breasts of my mother, that I may find thee without, and kiss thee, and now no man may despise me?
Solomon or Canticles__08.2: I will take hold of thee, and bring thee Into my mother's house: there thou shalt teach me, and I will give thee a cup of spiced wine and new wine of my pomegranates.
Solomon or Canticles__08.3: <u>His left hand</u> under my head, and his right hand shall embrace me.
Solomon or Canticles__08.4: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that you stir not up, nor awake my love till she please.
Solomon or Canticles__08.5: <u>Who is this</u> that cometh up from the desert, flowing with delights, leaning upon her beloved? Under the apple tree I raised thee up: there thy mother was corrupted, there she was defloured that bore thee.
Solomon or Canticles__08.6: Put me as a seal upon thy heart, as a seal upon thy arm, for love is strong as death, jealousy as hard as hell, the lamps thereof are fire and flames.
Solomon or Canticles__08.7: Many waters cannot quench charity, neither can the floods drown it: if a man should give all the substance of his house for love, he shall despise it as nothing.
Solomon or Canticles__08.8: <u>Our sister is little</u>, and hath no breasts. What shall we do to our sister in the day when she is to be spoken to?
Solomon or Canticles__08.9: If she be a wall: let us build upon it bulwarks of silver: if she be a door, let us join it together with boards or cedar.
Solomon or Canticles__08.10: I am a wall: and my breasts are as a tower since I am become in his presence as one finding peace.
Solomon or Canticles__08.11: The peaceable had a vineyard, in that which hath people: he let out the same to keepers, every man bringeth for the fruit thereof a thousand pieces of silver.
Solomon or Canticles__08.12: My vineyard is before me. A thousand are for thee, the peaceable, and two hundred for them that keep the fruit thereof.
Solomon or Canticles__08.13: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the friends hearken: make me hear thy voice.
Solomon or Canticles__08.14: Flee away, O my beloved, and be like to the roe, and to the young hart upon the mountains of aromatical spices.
